dt: {bc}being in the way or in front

pt: {sc}evident{/sc} {sc}manifest{/sc} {sc}patent{/sc} {sc}distinct{/sc} {sc}obvious{/sc} {sc}apparent{/sc} {sc}plain{/sc} {sc}clear{/sc} mean readily perceived or apprehended. {sc}evident{/sc} implies presence of visible signs that lead one to a definite conclusion.
{sc}manifest{/sc} implies an external display so evident that little or no inference is required.
{sc}patent{/sc} applies to a cause, effect, or significant feature that is clear and unmistakable once attention has been directed to it.
{sc}distinct{/sc} implies such sharpness of outline or definition that no unusual effort to see or hear or comprehend is required.
{sc}obvious{/sc} implies such ease in discovering that it often suggests conspicuousness or little need for perspicacity in the observer.
{sc}apparent{/sc} is very close to {sc}evident{/sc} except that it may imply more conscious exercise of inference.
{sc}plain{/sc} suggests lack of intricacy, complexity, or elaboration.
{sc}clear{/sc} implies an absence of anything that confuses the mind or obscures the pattern.
